definition: to urge (sb to do do sth)/to drive (sb to take an action)
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
old variant of 驅|驱[qu1]
variant of 驅|驱[qu1]
surname Ce
variant of 策[ce4]

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
variant of 策[ce4]

sentences.english: Urged by an extreme necessity, he had come there to steal food.
sentences.chinese: 在极度须要的驱策下，他才去那里偷食品。

sentences.english: China is also being driven by national pride.
sentences.chinese: 中国此举也是受到了民族自豪感的驱策。

sentences.english: For instance, majority rule works well when all rankings are ideologically driven.
sentences.chinese: 例如多数决在所有评比都受意识形态驱策时很管用。

sentences.english: Consumer spending drives 70 percent of the American economy.
sentences.chinese: 消费性开支驱策着美国70%的经济。

definition: to put to work (servant or animal)/to make use of for labor
to order (sb) about/(by extension) to put to use
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs

servant
to overawe/to be scared into submission

to send (on errand)
forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to bind/to tie/Taiwan pr. [fu2]
to call/to summon
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay
